text: George W. Grant George Washington Grant was a businessman and the owner of the Boston Braves of the National League from through . In 1919, he purchased the club from Percy Haughton estate. In 1922, he sold the franchise to Emil Fuchs. Grant was a motion picture and theatrical promoter in New York City. ==External links== *Atlanta Braves owners Category:Baseball executives Category:Boston Braves (baseball) Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: George W. Grant (Boston Braves owner)
